intro: Chelonopsis mollissima, commonly known as the velvetleaf chelonopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often blooming in the spring. It is typically found in moist, tropical environments and thrives in shaded areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
